instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message:
Hi.

Measured diode drop 0 on L7100 
Removed R7140 and got 0 drop on pin 2 pad for where R7140 used to be. No short on any of the 3 remaining pads.
Thought it may be bad bypass caps so injected voltage On pad 1 of C1768 @ 1v 4A and all that got hot was the CPU, nothing around it got hot on either side of the board.

Not sure where to go from here?

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message: What is resistance to GND? Not diode mode, need Ohms.

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6404"]What is resistance to GND? Not diode mode, need Ohms.[/QUOTE]

it's 0.4 ohms.

I was completely wrong, I don't even have PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message: Uhm, is there a short on PPBUS? 0.4 on L7100 is way too low, possibly shorted high side FET killing CPU and shorting out PPBUS?

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6411"]Uhm, is there a short on PPBUS? 0.4 on L7100 is way too low, possibly shorted high side FET killing CPU and shorting out PPBUS?
[/QUOTE]

Yes short on PPBUS_G3H. Removed F7040 got 12v5 no load from L7030. Chucked in some voltage on pin 2 pad of F7040. CPU getting hot.
I'll check Q7100 now

... Q7100 has a fat hole in it

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message: Ok, replaced Q7100 and fan spins then comes to a very abrupt stop

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H = 12.6V
L7030 to ground 1.1ohm

I'll post with something more useful

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message: Q7100 shorted and killed the CPU.....end of the line unless you want to replace the CPU.

threads.title: 820-2936 ppvccsa_s0_cpu
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6426"]Q7100 shorted and killed the CPU.....end of the line unless you want to replace the CPU.[/QUOTE]

Heinous.

Thanks Duke
